alert.note: Alert for Meigs (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 2:59PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Meigs, east central Mason, northwestern Kanawha, Putnam, Wirt, northwestern Roane, Jackson and southern Wood Counties through 330 PM EDT... At 258 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northeast of Ravenswood to near Ripley to near Teays Valley. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Charleston, Parkersburg, Nitro, Ripley, Winfield, Elizabeth, Jefferson, South Charleston, St. Albans, Dunbar, Hurricane, Ravenswood, Sissonville, Eleanor, Buffalo, Poca, Sandyville, Mineralwells, Institute and Cross Lanes. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 1 and 3. Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 103 and 171. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 33 and 52. Route 50 in West Virginia between mile markers 14 and 21. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
